é—®1 : ä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆè¦åœ¨å®ä½¿ç”¨do...while()?

do{â€¦}while(0) is the only construct in C that lets you define macros that always work the same way, so that a semicolon after your macro always has the same effect, regardless of how the macro is used (with particularly emphasis on the issue of nesting the macro in a if without curly-brackets).
